alert.note: Alert for Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ashe, southeastern Smyth and western Grayson Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flatwood, or near Whitetop, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lansing... Whitetop... Mouth Of Wilson... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Ashland... and Troutdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
